meanings.definition: To act as a parent or guardian to a child.
meanings.sent1: She parented her younger siblings while their parents were at work.
meanings.sent2: The teacher parented the students with care and understanding.
meanings.sent3: The babysitter parented the mischievous children with a playful spirit.
meanings.sent4: The coach parented the team to victory with his motivational speeches.
meanings.sent5: The kind neighbor parented the lost puppy until its owner was found.

meanings.definition: To bring forth or produce offspring.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree parented many delicious fruits in the orchard.
meanings.sent2: The bird parented a nest full of chirping baby birds.
meanings.sent3: The farmer parented a bumper crop of corn this season.
meanings.sent4: The flower parented a beautiful bloom that attracted bees.
meanings.sent5: The dog parented a litter of adorable puppies in the backyard.
